2080 // Load and rasterize multiple TTF/OTF fonts into a same texture. The font atlas will build a single texture holding:
2081 // - One or more fonts.
2082 // - Custom graphics data needed to render the shapes needed by Dear ImGui.
2083 // - Mouse cursor shapes for software cursor rendering (unless setting 'Flags |= ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors' in the font atlas).
2084 // It is the user-code responsibility to setup/build the atlas, then upload the pixel data into a texture accessible by your graphics api.
2085 // - Optionally, call any of the AddFont*** functions. If you don't call any, the default font embedded in the code will be loaded for you.
2086 // - Call GetTexDataAsAlpha8() or GetTexDataAsRGBA32() to build and retrieve pixels data.
2087 // - Upload the pixels data into a texture within your graphics system (see imgui_impl_xxxx.cpp examples)
2088 // - Call SetTexID(my_tex_id); and pass the pointer/identifier to your texture in a format natural to your graphics API.
2089 // This value will be passed back to you during rendering to identify the texture. Read FAQ entry about ImTextureID for more details.
2090 // Common pitfalls:
2091 // - If you pass a 'glyph_ranges' array to AddFont*** functions, you need to make sure that your array persist up until the
2092 // atlas is build (when calling GetTexData*** or Build()). We only copy the pointer, not the data.
2093 // - Important: By default, AddFontFromMemoryTTF() takes ownership of the data. Even though we are not writing to it, we will free the pointer on destruction.
2094 // You can set font_cfg->FontDataOwnedByAtlas=false to keep ownership of your data and it won't be freed,
2095 // - Even though many functions are suffixed with "TTF", OTF data is supported just as well.
2096 // - This is an old API and it is currently awkward for those and and various other reasons! We will address them in the future!
2097 struct ImFontAtlas
2098 {
2099  IMGUI_API ImFontAtlas();
2100  IMGUI_API ~ImFontAtlas();
2101  IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFont(const ImFontConfig* font_cfg);
2102  IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontDefault(const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL);
2103  IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromFileTTF(const char* filename, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL);
2104  IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromMemoryTTF(void* font_data, int font_size, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL); // Note: Transfer ownership of 'ttf_data' to ImFontAtlas! Will be deleted after destruction of the atlas. Set font_cfg->FontDataOwnedByAtlas=false to keep ownership of your data and it won't be freed.
2105  IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromMemoryCompressedTTF(const void* compressed_font_data, int compressed_font_size, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL); // 'compressed_font_data' still owned by caller. Compress with binary_to_compressed_c.cpp.
2106  IMGUI_API ImFont* AddFontFromMemoryCompressedBase85TTF(const char* compressed_font_data_base85, float size_pixels, const ImFontConfig* font_cfg = NULL, const ImWchar* glyph_ranges = NULL); // 'compressed_font_data_base85' still owned by caller. Compress with binary_to_compressed_c.cpp with -base85 parameter.
2107  IMGUI_API void ClearInputData(); // Clear input data (all ImFontConfig structures including sizes, TTF data, glyph ranges, etc.) = all the data used to build the texture and fonts.
2108  IMGUI_API void ClearTexData(); // Clear output texture data (CPU side). Saves RAM once the texture has been copied to graphics memory.
2109  IMGUI_API void ClearFonts(); // Clear output font data (glyphs storage, UV coordinates).
2110  IMGUI_API void Clear(); // Clear all input and output.
2111 
2112  // Build atlas, retrieve pixel data.
2113  // User is in charge of copying the pixels into graphics memory (e.g. create a texture with your engine). Then store your texture handle with SetTexID().
2114  // The pitch is always = Width * BytesPerPixels (1 or 4)
2115  // Building in RGBA32 format is provided for convenience and compatibility, but note that unless you manually manipulate or copy color data into
2116  // the texture (e.g. when using the AddCustomRect*** api), then the RGB pixels emitted will always be white (~75% of memory/bandwidth waste.
2117  IMGUI_API bool Build(); // Build pixels data. This is called automatically for you by the GetTexData*** functions.
2118  IMGUI_API void GetTexDataAsAlpha8(unsigned char** out_pixels, int* out_width, int* out_height, int* out_bytes_per_pixel = NULL); // 1 byte per-pixel
2119  IMGUI_API void GetTexDataAsRGBA32(unsigned char** out_pixels, int* out_width, int* out_height, int* out_bytes_per_pixel = NULL); // 4 bytes-per-pixel
2120  bool IsBuilt() const { return Fonts.Size > 0 && (TexPixelsAlpha8 != NULL || TexPixelsRGBA32 != NULL); }
2121  void SetTexID(ImTextureID id) { TexID = id; }
2122 
2123  //-------------------------------------------
2124  // Glyph Ranges
2125  //-------------------------------------------
2126 
2127  // Helpers to retrieve list of common Unicode ranges (2 value per range, values are inclusive, zero-terminated list)
2128  // NB: Make sure that your string are UTF-8 and NOT in your local code page. In C++11, you can create UTF-8 string literal using the u8"Hello world" syntax. See FAQ for details.
2129  // NB: Consider using ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder to build glyph ranges from textual data.
2130  IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesDefault(); // Basic Latin, Extended Latin
2131  IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesKorean(); // Default + Korean characters
2132  IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesJapanese(); // Default + Hiragana, Katakana, Half-Width, Selection of 1946 Ideographs
2133  IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesChineseFull(); // Default + Half-Width + Japanese Hiragana/Katakana + full set of about 21000 CJK Unified Ideographs
2134  IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesChineseSimplifiedCommon();// Default + Half-Width + Japanese Hiragana/Katakana + set of 2500 CJK Unified Ideographs for common simplified Chinese
2135  IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesCyrillic(); // Default + about 400 Cyrillic characters
2136  IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesThai(); // Default + Thai characters
2137  IMGUI_API const ImWchar* GetGlyphRangesVietnamese(); // Default + Vietnamese characters
2138 
2139  //-------------------------------------------
2140  // [BETA] Custom Rectangles/Glyphs API
2141  //-------------------------------------------
2142 
2143  // You can request arbitrary rectangles to be packed into the atlas, for your own purposes.
2144  // After calling Build(), you can query the rectangle position and render your pixels.
2145  // You can also request your rectangles to be mapped as font glyph (given a font + Unicode point),
2146  // so you can render e.g. custom colorful icons and use them as regular glyphs.
2147  // Read docs/FONTS.txt for more details about using colorful icons.
2148  IMGUI_API int AddCustomRectRegular(unsigned int id, int width, int height); // Id needs to be >= 0x110000. Id >= 0x80000000 are reserved for ImGui and ImDrawList
2149  IMGUI_API int AddCustomRectFontGlyph(ImFont* font, ImWchar id, int width, int height, float advance_x, const ImVec2& offset = ImVec2(0,0)); // Id needs to be < 0x110000 to register a rectangle to map into a specific font.
2150  const ImFontAtlasCustomRect*GetCustomRectByIndex(int index) const { if (index < 0) return NULL; return &CustomRects[index]; }
2151 
2152  // [Internal]
2153  IMGUI_API void CalcCustomRectUV(const ImFontAtlasCustomRect* rect, ImVec2* out_uv_min, ImVec2* out_uv_max) const;
2154  IMGUI_API bool GetMouseCursorTexData(ImGuiMouseCursor cursor, ImVec2* out_offset, ImVec2* out_size, ImVec2 out_uv_border[2], ImVec2 out_uv_fill[2]);
2155 
2156  //-------------------------------------------
2157  // Members
2158  //-------------------------------------------
2159 
2160  bool Locked; // Marked as Locked by ImGui::NewFrame() so attempt to modify the atlas will assert.
2161  ImFontAtlasFlags Flags; // Build flags (see ImFontAtlasFlags_)
2162  ImTextureID TexID; // User data to refer to the texture once it has been uploaded to user's graphic systems. It is passed back to you during rendering via the ImDrawCmd structure.
2163  int TexDesiredWidth; // Texture width desired by user before Build(). Must be a power-of-two. If have many glyphs your graphics API have texture size restrictions you may want to increase texture width to decrease height.
2164  int TexGlyphPadding; // Padding between glyphs within texture in pixels. Defaults to 1. If your rendering method doesn't rely on bilinear filtering you may set this to 0.
2165 
2166  // [Internal]
2167  // NB: Access texture data via GetTexData*() calls! Which will setup a default font for you.
2168  unsigned char* TexPixelsAlpha8; // 1 component per pixel, each component is unsigned 8-bit. Total size = TexWidth * TexHeight
2169  unsigned int* TexPixelsRGBA32; // 4 component per pixel, each component is unsigned 8-bit. Total size = TexWidth * TexHeight * 4
2170  int TexWidth; // Texture width calculated during Build().
2171  int TexHeight; // Texture height calculated during Build().
2172  ImVec2 TexUvScale; // = (1.0f/TexWidth, 1.0f/TexHeight)
2173  ImVec2 TexUvWhitePixel; // Texture coordinates to a white pixel
2174  ImVector<ImFont*> Fonts; // Hold all the fonts returned by AddFont*. Fonts[0] is the default font upon calling ImGui::NewFrame(), use ImGui::PushFont()/PopFont() to change the current font.
2175  ImVector<ImFontAtlasCustomRect> CustomRects; // Rectangles for packing custom texture data into the atlas.
2176  ImVector<ImFontConfig> ConfigData; // Internal data
2177  int CustomRectIds[1]; // Identifiers of custom texture rectangle used by ImFontAtlas/ImDrawList
2178

2181  typedef ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder GlyphRangesBuilder; // OBSOLETED in 1.67+

2185 // Font runtime data and rendering
2186 // ImFontAtlas automatically loads a default embedded font for you when you call GetTexDataAsAlpha8() or GetTexDataAsRGBA32().
2187 struct ImFont
2188 {
2189  // Members: Hot ~20/24 bytes (for CalcTextSize)
2190  ImVector<float> IndexAdvanceX; // 12-16 // out // // Sparse. Glyphs->AdvanceX in a directly indexable way (cache-friendly for CalcTextSize functions which only this this info, and are often bottleneck in large UI).
2191  float FallbackAdvanceX; // 4 // out // = FallbackGlyph->AdvanceX
2192  float FontSize; // 4 // in // // Height of characters/line, set during loading (don't change after loading)
2193 
2194  // Members: Hot ~36/48 bytes (for CalcTextSize + render loop)
2195  ImVector<ImWchar> IndexLookup; // 12-16 // out // // Sparse. Index glyphs by Unicode code-point.
2196  ImVector<ImFontGlyph> Glyphs; // 12-16 // out // // All glyphs.
2197  const ImFontGlyph* FallbackGlyph; // 4-8 // out // = FindGlyph(FontFallbackChar)
2198  ImVec2 DisplayOffset; // 8 // in // = (0,0) // Offset font rendering by xx pixels
2199 
2200  // Members: Cold ~32/40 bytes
2201  ImFontAtlas* ContainerAtlas; // 4-8 // out // // What we has been loaded into
2202  const ImFontConfig* ConfigData; // 4-8 // in // // Pointer within ContainerAtlas->ConfigData
2203  short ConfigDataCount; // 2 // in // ~ 1 // Number of ImFontConfig involved in creating this font. Bigger than 1 when merging multiple font sources into one ImFont.
2204  ImWchar FallbackChar; // 2 // in // = '?' // Replacement character if a glyph isn't found. Only set via SetFallbackChar()
2205  ImWchar EllipsisChar; // 2 // out // = -1 // Character used for ellipsis rendering.
2206  float Scale; // 4 // in // = 1.f // Base font scale, multiplied by the per-window font scale which you can adjust with SetWindowFontScale()
2207  float Ascent, Descent; // 4+4 // out // // Ascent: distance from top to bottom of e.g. 'A' [0..FontSize]
2208  int MetricsTotalSurface;// 4 // out // // Total surface in pixels to get an idea of the font rasterization/texture cost (not exact, we approximate the cost of padding between glyphs)
2209  bool DirtyLookupTables; // 1 // out //
2210 
2211  // Methods
2212  IMGUI_API ImFont();
2213  IMGUI_API ~ImFont();
2214  IMGUI_API const ImFontGlyph*FindGlyph(ImWchar c) const;
2215  IMGUI_API const ImFontGlyph*FindGlyphNoFallback(ImWchar c) const;
2216  float GetCharAdvance(ImWchar c) const { return ((int)c < IndexAdvanceX.Size) ? IndexAdvanceX[(int)c] : FallbackAdvanceX; }
2217  bool IsLoaded() const { return ContainerAtlas != NULL; }
2218  const char* GetDebugName() const { return ConfigData ? ConfigData->Name : "<unknown>"; }
2219 
2220  // 'max_width' stops rendering after a certain width (could be turned into a 2d size). FLT_MAX to disable.
2221  // 'wrap_width' enable automatic word-wrapping across multiple lines to fit into given width. 0.0f to disable.
2222  IMGUI_API ImVec2 CalcTextSizeA(float size, float max_width, float wrap_width, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end = NULL, const char** remaining = NULL) const; // utf8
2223  IMGUI_API const char* CalcWordWrapPositionA(float scale, const char* text, const char* text_end, float wrap_width) const;
2224  IMGUI_API void RenderChar(ImDrawList* draw_list, float size, ImVec2 pos, ImU32 col, ImWchar c) const;
2225  IMGUI_API void RenderText(ImDrawList* draw_list, float size, ImVec2 pos, ImU32 col, const ImVec4& clip_rect, const char* text_begin, const char* text_end, float wrap_width = 0.0f, bool cpu_fine_clip = false) const;
